entries.title: Arrive at Hotel Hispano
entries.address: C/ de Hortaleza, 38, 2º, Centro, 28004 Madrid, Spain
entries.content: Our flight got in very early! We headed to the hostel to drop off our stuff. Dad navigated the narrow streets on Madrid like a pro.

photos.caption: From the window in our room, looking down Calle de Hortaleza.

entries.title: Breakfast at Loreto Coffee Bar (and a nap)
entries.address: Corre. Baja de San Pablo, 6, Centro, 28004 Madrid, Spain
entries.content: No pictures here as everyone was way too tired to even take our phones. We ordered a massive slice of tortilla and Mom made her first of many comments about eating too much bread. We then headed back to the hotel for a nap.

entries.title: Gran Via
entries.content: After almost two hours of napping we started our first day into the busy streets of Madrid.

entries.title: Puerta del Sol
entries.address: Prta del Sol, s/n, Centro, 28013 Madrid, Spain
entries.content: Our first stop was the Puerta del Sol. Little did we know we were in Madrid the day before the Day of Madrid and multiple stages had been built for the celebration.

entries.title: The First Beer (of many)
entries.address: Pl. de Celenque, 1, Centro, 28013 Madrid, Spain
entries.content: We stopped for our first beer at a Cañas y Tapas, a chain tapas restaurant. In my defense, the nearby Casa Labra had a big line.

entries.title: Circling the Parroquia de San Ginés
entries.address: Pasadizo de San Ginés, 5, Centro, 28013 Madrid, Spain
entries.content: We continued on in the direction of the famous Chocolatería San Ginés.

photos.caption: Mom is going to hate this photo.

entries.title: Plaza Mayor
entries.content: We took another break in the gorgeous Plaza Mayor. Dad drank some brown, Mom had sangria that was a bit too sweet, and I had a gin & tonic. This was also one of the many times we ate croquettes.

entries.title: Mercado de San Miguel
entries.address: Pl. de San Miguel, s/n, Centro, 28005 Madrid, Spain
entries.content: A very, very quick stroll (mosh crossing) through the Mercado de San Miguel. Truly not enough space to pull out a phone so our photos are limited to Mom's shot of some pretty olives.

entries.title: Catedral de Santa María la Real de la Almudena & Palacio Real de Madrid
entries.content: We arrived at the Palacio Real de Madrid after a short tour of the Cathedral.

entries.title: Dinner at EL miniBAR
entries.address: C/ del Mesón de Paños, 1, Centro, 28013 Madrid, Spain
entries.content: My master googling and tour guiding skills led us to an awesome tapas restaurant between the Opera house and Plaza Mayor.

entries.title: Ambrosio & A Concert in Puerta del Sol
entries.address: Calle de la Bolsa, 5, Centro, 28012 Madrid, Spain
entries.content: A bit of aimless wandering in the direction of Puerta del Sol paid off when we stopped at Ambrosio. We all loved it here, it might be our favorite bar of the trip! Great drinks, good energy, friendly staff, free raciónes.

photos.caption: The band playing was called 'Lisasinson'. They had a 90's power pop, twee rocker vibe. "Tontipop"

entries.title: Museo Nacional del Prado
entries.address: Museo Nacional del Prado, Madrid, Spain
entries.content: We woke up not so early, grabbed a quick bite to eat in Chueca, and stood in a very long line to get into the Prado. We all loved the museum; highlights were the dark Goya pieces and the room dedicated to Hieronymus Bosch.

photos.caption: I was reprimanded by the nicest security guard who simply pointed at my phone and wagged their finger.

entries.title: A stroll through Parque de El Retiro
entries.address: Parque de El Retiro, Madrid, Spain
entries.content: Jet leg plus three hours in the museum meant we were exhausted, so we took it easy and strolled through Parque de El Retiro.

entries.title: Dinner at Txirimiri Ferraz
entries.address: C. de Ferraz, 38, Moncloa - Aravaca, 28008 Madrid, Spain
entries.content: Foreshadowing our upcoming trip to the Basque country, we ended up at a Basque restaurant (not pictured). We tried our hand at navigating the Madrid Metro!

entries.title: Partying in Chueca
entries.address: C. de Gravina, 13, Centro, 28004 Madrid, Spain
entries.content: The area of Madrid we stayed in is called Chueca which is known for its nightlife. A local pointed us to a nearby bar called Escape when my mom explained we were looking for a place to dance!

photos.caption: Mom singing karaoke. The crowd went wild for 'Sweet Caroline'.
